snippet: President Obama’s top “bundlers” raised or gave at least $200 million for his re-election bid and the Democratic National Committee through the end of May, close to half the total.
abstract: Campaign documents show Pres Obama’s top 'bundlers' raised or gave at least $200 million for his re-election bid and the Democratic National Committee through the end of May, close to half of the total up to that point; campaign's big-dollar fund-raising has become more dependent than it was in 2008 on a smaller number of large-dollar donors and fund-raisers.

byline.contributor: Jo Craven McGinty, Derek Willis, and Kitty Bennett contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s top “bundlers” raised or gave at least $200 million for his re-election bid and the Democratic National Committee through the end of May, close to half the total.

headline.main: Obama Grows More Reliant on Big-Money Contributors
headline.print_headline: Obama Grows More Reliant On Big-Money Contributors
